main event: A stationary orange-colored round object with a flat bottom was observed for 20 minutes southwest of Herschel Island, Canada.
interesting points: The object was the size of half a full orange at arm's length.
The object appeared to have a slight movement when watched steadily, but otherwise remained stationary.
The object disappeared suddenly and did not fade or move away.
The sighting was reported to the DEW Line at 1842 on January 23, 1959.
The report concluded that the object was likely the moon, partially hidden by cloud cover just above the horizon.
sighted object: Round orange-colored object with a flat bottom
